III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Allegation 1:
A youth is being abused by staff at the facility. The staff kick, hit
and punch the youth. On 6/03/25, the youth was trying to run
away from the facility and the staff were throwing sticks at the
youth. The youth is the only child targeted.
Allegations 2:
On 06/05/25, Youth A was with an unknown female staff member
and a couple unknown residents, making a medical run to the
dentist office. The unknown female staff member pulled a branch
off the tree in front of the dentist office and hit Youth A leaving a
black and blue Nickle size bruise on Youth A right wrist. It is
unknown why the incident occurred. There were no other staff
members or residents present during the incident.
Investigation Allegation 1:
Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via telephone on 6/5/25, but the
contact was unsuccessful.
Youth A was interviewed on 6/5/2025 face to face at
Wolverine Center with MDHHS worker. Youth A reported not
feeling safe at the facility, because an unknown staff member
threw sticks at him 3 days prior to this interview. Youth A reported
not knowing the identity of the staff member but reported the
incident occurred during a daytime shift. Youth A had a visible
bruise on his arm. Youth A reported the bruise came from the
unknown staff member hitting him with the stick. Youth A reported
he was sitting outside when the unknown staff member picked up
a stick and hit him with it. Youth A reported he also AWOL’d with
another youth he called “little brother”. Youth A reported telling law
enforcement about his bruise when he was picked up from AWOL.
2

Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on 7/1/25 with MDHHS
worker. Staff 5 reported he has never seen Youth A hit with a
stick.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 6/11/2025 face to face at
Wolverine Center with MDHHS worker. Supervisor 1 reported
not being aware of Youth A’s AWOL incident that occurred the
week of June 2nd. Supervisor 1 reported he never saw any staff
member from Wolverine hit Youth A. Supervisor 1 reported
observing Youth A and other youth from the facility play bow and
arrow with the sticks outside but reported this play was not
aggressive. Supervisor 1 reported being surprised that Youth A
AWOL’ d, because he doesn’t normally AWOL.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed on 6/11/25 face to face at
Wolverine Center with MDHHS worker. Supervisor 2 reported
being on the schedule on 6/2/25. Supervisor 2 reported Youth A
was not hit with a stick by anyone at the facility, including peers
and staff members. Supervisor 2 reported Youth A was admitted
to the facility with a bruise on his leg and pictures were taken at
intake during body charting. Supervisor 2 reported staff always try
to de-escalate Youth A but he does not listen.
Therapist was contacted via telephone on 6/11/25. Per
Therapist, Youth A disclosed he was hit with sticks outside of the
facility for some unknown reason by Staff 1. Therapist reported
having no other knowledge of the incident. Therapist reported
viewing the marks on the youth and completed a report and
notified his supervisor. Therapist reported no concerns with Staff
1. Therapist reported he has never seen staff 1 or any other staff
hit Youth A.
Staff 5 was interviewed on 6/11/25 face to face at Wolverine
Center with MDHHS worker. Staff 5 was interviewed on 6/11/25
face to face at Wolverine Center with MDHHS worker. Staff 5
reported being previously assigned as one of Youth A’s one-to-
one on 6/2/25. Staff 5 reported Youth A has never AWOL’d on his
shift but recalled a time when Youth A and some other unknown
Youth were playing bow and arrow with some sticks outside of the
facility. Staff 5 reported he did not see any youth or staff hit Youth
A with a stick. Staff 5 also recalled a time when he saw Youth A
sleeping on a bench outside of the facility. Staff 5 reported the
Youth was being supervised by an unknown staff. Staff 5 reported
he did not see this staff member hit Youth A. Staff 5 reported
when Youth A does not get his way, Youth A becomes angry and
destroys property. Staff 5 was uncertain about how the bruise on
3

Youth A's arm and the scratch on his leg occurred. Staff 5 was
able to identify Youth B as the Youth A calls “little brother”.
Allegation 2:
Vice President (VP) was interviewed on 6/11/25 face to face at
Wolverine Center. VP reported being aware of the incident that
occurred in the dental office parking lot but is not aware of Youth
A being hit with a branch. VP reported Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C went to the dental office. VP reported Youth A usually
AWOL's at least three times a week. VP reported Youth A had
been placed since 5/22/25. According to VP, Youth A is now
placed at a psychiatrist hospital due to his behaviors.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at Wolverine Center with
MDHHS worker on 7/1/25. Staff 1 reported Youth A went AWOL
from the facility earlier in the day and was picked up from the
police station. Staff 1 reported once at the facility, Youth A refused
to get out of the van. Staff 1 reported she and the other staff
gathered Youth B and Youth C and went to the dental office.
Staff 1 reported once she arrived at the dentist’s office, she and
Youth A remained in the car. Staff 1 reported she left the van door
open for ventilation. Staff 1 reported Youth A began to scream that
he wanted to go back to the facility. Staff 1 reported using verbal
de-escalation skills to coach and redirect Youth A, but Youth A
would not listen. Staff 1 reported Youth A was seated at the back
of the van in the last row but began to crawl over the seats. Staff 1
reported trying to block the door by standing in front of it but Youth
A brushed passed her. Staff 1 reported following Youth A until he
was out of line of sight. Staff 1 reported contacting her supervisor.
Staff 1 reported she continued to walk and eventually saw Youth A
inside the back of a police vehicle. Staff 1 reported Youth A did
not scream in the parking lot. Staff 1 denied hitting Youth A with a
stick and reported there were no sticks in the parking lot to hit
Youth A with.
Youth B was interviewed face to face on 6/11/25 at Capstone
Academy. Youth B identified himself as Youth A’s “little brother”.
Youth B reported witnessing Staff 1 hit Youth A with a stick. It was
not at the dentist’s office, but at Wolverine Center. Youth B
appeared distracted during the interview. Youth B did not want to
speak much more about the topic and opted to end the interview.
Youth C was interviewed face to face on 6/11/25 at School.
Youth C reported being one of the youth who went to the dentist
on 6/5/25. Youth C reported, he and Youth B were scheduled to
4

go to the dentist. Youth C reported Youth A got in the van and
refused to get out of the van. Youth C reported Youth A began to
act out, so Staff 2 decided to take him and Youth B to the dentist
with the goal of dropping Youth A back off. Youth C reported once
at the dentist’s office, Youth A got out of the van and started
screaming and yelling in the parking lot. Youth C reported Youth A
was screaming for help and stating that Staff 2 was trying to rape
and beat him. Youth C reported no staff hit Youth A. Youth C
reported Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 were present. Youth C
reported Staff 2 was trying to verbally de-escalate Youth A, but
Youth A kept walking. Youth C reported observing Staff 2 follow
Youth A until she lost line of sight. Youth C reported Youth A acts
out when he does not get his way.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed on 6/11/25 face to face at
Wolverine Center with MDHHS worker. As stated above
Supervisor 2 reported Youth A was admitted to the facility with a
bruise on his leg and pictures were taken at intake during body
charting.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone with MDHHS worker on
6/12/25. Staff 2 reported being in the van with Youth A on 6/5/25.
Staff 2 reported Youth A refused to get out of the van so that her
co-workers could transport the other youth to the dental office.
Staff 2 reported Youth A AWOL’d from the dentist parking lot and
was later picked up by Law Enforcement. Staff 2 reported not
observing Staff 1 or any other staff member hit Youth A with a
stick or branch.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 6/11/25 face to face at Wolverine
with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 reported when she came outside the
facility to transport Youth B to the dentist, she observed Youth A in
the transport van. Staff 3 reported being present with Youth A in
the van and while on transport. Staff 3 reported being in the
transport van and at the dentist when the incident occurred. Staff
3 reported seeing Youth A in the parking lot kicking the van as she
was taking her youth inside the dental office. Staff 3 reported once
she got into the dental office, she was unable to see the parking
lot. Staff 3 reported she did not observe any marks or bruises on
Youth A. Staff 3 reported she did not witness any staff member hit
Youth A.
Staff 4 was contacted on 6/11/25, 6/12/25, and 7/1/25 via
telephone but was unable to be reached.
Video Reviewed:
5

Video footage of 6/5/25 outside of Wolverine Center was viewed
on 7/2/25. Video shows Wolverine grey transport van pull up to
the facility. Staff 1 is observed getting out of the van and standing
outside of the van. Youth A never exits the van.
Video Footage 2 of 6/5/25 outside of Wolverine Center was
viewed on 7/2/25. The video shows Youth A leave through the
side door of Wolverine. Staff 1 is seen leaving behind Youth A.
Staff 1 is seen following Youth A up the street towards the cross
street until the video ends.
Documents Reviewed:
Incident Reported dated 6/5/25 authored by Staff 1 was
consistent with Staff 1 interview.
Staff 1’s personnel file. Staff 1 completed CPI Non-Violent
Physical Management training on 5/17/25, Truancy
Prevention/Line of Sight training on 3/18/25, and Behavioral
Management training on 3/18/25. Staff 1 received disciplined on
4/18/25 and 5/29/25 for unrelated incidents. Staff 1 was
disciplined on 6/30/25 for use of excessive force during a restraint.
Staff 1 was terminated.
Truancy Policy: When a truancy occurs, the following steps will
be taken:
1. Staff will make efforts to verbally redirect the truanting client
and will offer the client support and alternatives to truancy.
a. If a non-supervising staff is available, they will walk
with the client and continue to provide verbal support
and redirection encouraging the client not to truant.
b. Staff will not physically intervene with the client on
WHS property other than in accordance with CPI
protocol regarding danger to self or others.
2. Staff supervising the group will immediately call a group
attention to support and maintain the security of the group.
3. Staff will maintain control of the group and conduct an
immediate head count.
4. Staff will immediately notify the Youth Care Specialist
Supervisor on duty when line of sight is lost, no later than
15 from loss of line of sight (when youth is determined
AWOL).
5. The Youth Specialist Supervisor will contact the Lead
Supervisor and Program Management who will provide
oversight for incident management.
6

6. The youth specialist supervisor will ensure law enforcement
is notified immediately (no more than 5 minutes from when
youth is determined AWOL.
7. Staff will report the following information immediately to the
Youth Care Specialist Supervisor on duty;
8. Name(s) of the truant client(s).
9. Approximate time and location of the truancy.
10. The direction of travel the client(s) was/were headed.
11. Whether the client(s) appear(s) to present a danger to self
or others in the community.
12. Circumstances prior to the truancy, risk assessment and
other pertinent safety related information.
1. Truancy Notification: In event a client truants from WHS
property or from a home pass the following notifications
will be made;
2. Program Manager or Director (immediately)
3. Local law enforcement agency (immediately)
Youth A case record was reviewed. Youth A is diagnosed with
Disruptive mood dysregulation disorder, Encopresis; Major
Depressive Disorder, Recurrent episode, Severe, PTSD, and
ADHD.
Youth A Body Chart dated 5/22/25 was reviewed. On 5/22/25,
Youth A was placed at Wolverine. This document indicates Youth
A came into the facility with a scratch on his left and right arm. The
body chart also indicated Youth A had a scrape on his right leg
and a bruise on his right thigh. The documents indicated at intake
Youth A stated he was hit with a pipe.
Analysis Allegation 1:
The agency is found in compliance as per staff interviews,
documentation reviewed, and Video staff did not hit Youth A.
Allegation 2:
The agency is found in compliance as per staff interviews, and
documentation reviewed Youth A was not hit with sticks or any
other object.
Conclusion Violation Not Established.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
